ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: CreateColumn
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Add a specific column in a database table.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Add a specific column in a database table.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: Table
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Find the table requested by the user in the table type reference, the user will pass you the "db_table_name". You should try for example "q": "dBTableName=='M_Product'". Save the table ID.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Find the table requested by the user in the table type reference using the database table name. Use query parameter example: "q": "dBTableName=='M_Product'". Save the table ID from the response.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create a new table entry in the table type reference. Provide the database table name and other required table configuration parameters.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing table information in the table type reference using the table ID. Modify table properties and configuration as needed.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: ReferencesList
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Endpoint that creates a reference list tab in the created header. In module_id, use the module id of the reference. Creates a record for each reference list item of type. The search key for the list item will be the first 3 letters of the list name.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve reference list items and their associated data for a specific reference module. Search for existing reference list configurations.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create a reference list tab in the created header. In module_id, use the module id of the reference. Creates a record for each reference list item of type. The search key for the list item will be the first 3 letters of the list name.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing reference list items and their properties. Modify search keys, names, and associated module configurations for reference list entries.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: moduleDBPrefix
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Add a DB prefix to the created module. The "module" field is the Module ID. If the prefix to be used is used by another module, add an extra capital letter and try again.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve the current database prefix configuration for a specific module. Search existing prefixes to check availability.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Add a DB prefix to the created module. The "module" field is the Module ID. If the prefix to be used is used by another module, add an extra capital letter and try again.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update the database prefix for an existing module. If the prefix to be used is used by another module, add an extra capital letter and try again.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: RegisterWindow
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Creates a Window in Etendo and add a Menu entry for it.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Creates a Window in Etendo and add a Menu entry for it.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: CreateAndRegisterTable
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Create a table in the database with the basic columns, without any specific columns and register in Etendo a table previously created in the database.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create a table in the database with the basic columns, without any specific columns and register in Etendo a table previously created in the database.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: AddForeign
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Its a variant of AddColumn made for create Foreign keys from a table to other table. Like the other process, must be followed for a Register Column and a Sync terms.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Its a variant of AddColumn made for create Foreign keys from a table to other table. Like the other process, must be followed for a Register Column and a Sync terms.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: TreeCkeck
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Take the name of a table passed to you by the user and look up its ID. To register a table as a tree, use the table ID and make a PUT request to the TreeCkeck/{table_id} endpoint, setting "istree" to true, as a boolean value (no quotes, must be a boolean data type and not a string).
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve the current tree configuration status for a specific table by its ID.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create a new tree configuration entry for a table using the table ID.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update table tree configuration by setting the "istree" property to true or false using the table ID.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: GetWindowTabOrTableInfo
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Allow to read the information of a Window, Tab or Table in Etendo.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Allow to read the information of a Window, Tab or Table in Etendo.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: moduleDataPackage
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Add a Data package to the created module. The field "module" is the ID of the Module and field "javaPackage" is the java package of the module with ".data" at the end. The Standad name is the Module Name "Data Package" and the end. Only set this fields when creating.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve data package information for a specific module including java package configuration and naming conventions.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Add a data package to the created module. The field "module" is the ID of the Module and field "javaPackage" is the java package of the module with ".data" at the end. The standard name is the Module Name "Data Package" at the end. Only set these fields when creating.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing data package configuration for a module. Modify the java package settings and naming conventions. The javaPackage should end with ".data".

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: moduleHeader
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Manage the Module entity. Knowing the "module name" you can search the info of the module searching by name filtering wuth "q": "name=ic=\'name\'"
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Search the info of the module by name using filtering with "q": "name=ic='name'". Retrieve module information and configuration details.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create a new module entity with the specified name and configuration parameters. Set up the module header with required properties.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing module entity information including name and other module properties. Modify module configuration and settings.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: ReferencesHeader
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Create the header of a reference. If the reference is of the type of list, parentReference established in "17" if it is of type table, configure it in "18". When creating the body of the application, in "module" use the ID obtained from the module with that prefix, you should not use the prefix. Only identification. For example, if the prefix is ​​"COPDEV" and the ID is "D18B2E6830F84C3DAD445AB026623B99" Then the references will be sent something like: {"module": "D18B2E6830F84C3DAD445AB026623B99", "name": "Product Reference ","parentReference":" 18","description":" Reference for Products Using M_Product_id as Key and Value as Display Column. ","helpComment":" This reference links to the m_product Table Using m_product}
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve reference header information including parent reference type and module configuration. Search for existing reference configurations.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create the header of a reference. If the reference is of the type of list, parentReference established in "17" if it is of type table, configure it in "18". In "module" use the ID obtained from the module with that prefix, you should not use the prefix. Only identification. Example: {"module": "D18B2E6830F84C3DAD445AB026623B99", "name": "Product Reference", "parentReference": "18", "description": "Reference for Products Using M_Product_id as Key and Value as Display Column.", "helpComment": "This reference links to the m_product Table Using m_product"}
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing reference header configuration including parent reference type and module settings. Modify reference properties, parentReference (17 for list, 18 for table), and module associations.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: ElementsHandler
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: This webhook allows to read the Elements generated after the Terminology Synchronization. Has a mode to read the incomplete elements and other mode to write the missing information. After complete this information is necessary to execute the process of SyncTerms.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: This webhook allows to read the Elements generated after the Terminology Synchronization. Has a mode to read the incomplete elements and other mode to write the missing information. After complete this information is necessary to execute the process of SyncTerms.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: RegisterColumns
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Executes the Registration process for Columns of a previously registered Table. This process reads the database columns and register incrementally the columns. This process needs to be executed after add columns to the table in DB.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Executes the Registration process for Columns of a previously registered Table. This process reads the database columns and register incrementally the columns. This process needs to be executed after add columns to the table in DB.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: SyncTerms
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Executes the process of terminology Synchronization. This process needs to be executed After Column registration and after field registration.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Executes the process of terminology Synchronization. This process needs to be executed After Column registration and after field registration.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: ValidationSetup
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: endpoint that creates a "Validation" for a selector, In Module, we set the module ID. In Name, we put the name of the validation given by the user. In Description, we infer a description. In ValidationCode, we set the validation given by the user. In Type, if the user chooses "HQL", we set the value "HQL_JS". If the user chooses "SQL", we set the value "S".
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve validation configuration for a specific selector including type and validation code. Search for existing validations by module ID or validation name.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create a "Validation" for a selector. In Module, set the module ID. In Name, put the name of the validation given by the user. In Description, infer a description. In ValidationCode, set the validation given by the user. In Type, if the user chooses "HQL", set the value "HQL_JS". If the user chooses "SQL", set the value "S".
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing validation configuration. Modify validation code, type (HQL_JS for HQL, S for SQL), name, and description for a selector validation.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: ViewColumn
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION:
You need to search for columns related to a table using table_id and the name passed to you by the user. You need to search using only "table" and the "name", otherwise you will not find the columns. You need to return 200 columns from that table that have approximately the same name as the one submitted by the user. IMPORTANT! When using "_endRow" in endpoints, always set the value to "200". Example request: ?q=table=='ID'&_startRow=0&_endRow=200 Other example is by name ?q=name=ic='NAME'&_startRow=0&_endRow=200
When you build the query in the "viewcolumn" endpoint, use the "table" property. Save the ID of the found columns. When you setting the reference in a column. If the reference is base, his ID must be in the reference of Column. But if the reference is not base, must be in the "referenceSearchKey" propertie, and the parent ID of the reference, must be in the "reference" property column.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Search for columns related to a table using table_id and the name passed by the user. Use only "table" and "name" in the search. Return 200 columns from that table. IMPORTANT! Always set "_endRow" to "200". Example requests: ?q=table=='ID'&_startRow=0&_endRow=200 or ?q=name=ic='NAME'&_startRow=0&_endRow=200. Use the "table" property when building the query. Save the ID of the found columns.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create new column entries for a table with appropriate reference configuration. When setting the reference in a column: If the reference is base, its ID must be in the reference of Column. If the reference is not base, it must be in the "referenceSearchKey" property, and the parent ID of the reference must be in the "reference" property column.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing column configuration including reference settings. When setting the reference in a column: If the reference is base, its ID must be in the reference of Column. If the reference is not base, it must be in the "referenceSearchKey" property, and the parent ID of the reference must be in the "reference" property column.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: ModulePrefix
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: We only need the name of the dbPrefix, you must use the name and not the dbPrefix. "q": "name=ic=\'copdev\'" Once you have the module, save the value of the "module" property, which is the id of the module. don't save the "id" property, it's not needed.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Search for the module by the name of the dbPrefix using "q": "name=ic='copdev'". Use the name and not the dbPrefix. Once you have the module, save the value of the "module" property, which is the id of the module. Don't save the "id" property, it's not needed.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create a new module prefix configuration with the specified database prefix name and module association.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing module prefix configuration and associated module properties. Modify the database prefix name and module relationships.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: RegisterFields
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Executes the Fields registration process for a given tab. It creates/updates the fields based in the table in DB. This process is necesary to excecute after the Tab registration or after the registration of new columns in the linked table.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Executes the Fields registration process for a given tab. It creates/updates the fields based in the table in DB. This process is necesary to excecute after the Tab registration or after the registration of new columns in the linked table.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: CheckTablesColumnHook
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: webhook to check column and table validations
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Execute a process to check column and table validations. Retrieves issues o messages explaining the auto-fixes done.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: RegisterTab
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Creates a tab in Etendo, associated showing the data of a table. After create a Tab, will not have any field, so it necessary execute the Fields Registration process, to generate the fields based in the columns of the associated table.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Creates a tab in Etendo, associated showing the data of a table. After create a Tab, will not have any field, so it necessary execute the Fields Registration process, to generate the fields based in the columns of the associated table.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: ADMessage
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Manage AD Messages.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve AD message information and configurations from the system.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create new AD messages with specified content and configuration parameters.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing AD message content and configuration settings.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: TableTreeConfiguration
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: You must put in “module” the ID of the module you are working on. In “table” you must search and assign the ID of the table that the user mentioned to you. In “name”, put the name chosen by the user for the table. In the “treeStructure” property, assign “ADTree”. ⚠ Important: In the “table” property, you must send the ID of the table instead of the name. If the user only provides the name of the table, first use the “ViewTable” endpoint to get its ID and then use it in this request.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: Column
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve column information including reference type and configuration parameters. Search for column details by ID.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create a new column with specified reference type and search key configuration. Set appropriate reference parameters for list-type columns.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Take the ID of the column that the user wants to be of type list and modify the "reference" parameter to "17" and in the "referenceSearchKey" parameter put the ID of the reference. Example: {'endpoint': '/sws/com.etendoerp.etendorx.datasource/ChangeColumn/"COLUMN_ID"', 'method': 'PUT', 'body_params': '{"reference":"17","referenceSearchKey":"REFERENCE_ID"}'}

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: Reference
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: They will give you a reference ID and you must bring the data of the same, the type parameter and the name
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve reference data including type parameter and name using the reference ID.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create a new reference entry with specified type parameter and name configuration.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing reference data including type parameter and name properties.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: AddColumnFlow
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Add columns to a table in Etendo with correct registration in both database and Application Dictionary (AD). Required parameters: TableName, ColumnName, ColumnType, CanBeNull, IsExternal, ExternalModulePrefix. For "List" type columns, ReferenceId is required. Data type mappings: "String" → character varying(200), "Integer" → numeric, "DateTime" → timestamp without time zone, "YesNo" → character(1) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'N' CHECK (column IN ('Y', 'N')). For "List" type, assign reference in AD instead of fixed data type.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve existing column configurations for a table. Check if the table exists in the database using viewTable. Validate existing column types and their data type mappings.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION:
Your task is to add columns to a table in Etendo, ensuring that they are correctly registered both in the database and in the Application Dictionary (AD).
Each column must have the correct data type, validate its values, and, if necessary, create references in the AD.
🔹 Input Parameters
When a user requests to add a column, the following parameters are required: Parameter Description TableName Name of the table where the column will be added. ColumnName Name of the column to be added. ColumnType Data type of the column. Possible values: "Absolute DateTime", "Absolute Time", "Amount", "Assignment", "Binary", "Button", "Button List", "Color", "Date", "DateTime", "DateTime_From (Date)", "DateTime_To (Date)", "General Quantity", "ID", "Image", "Image BLOB", "Integer", "Link", "List", "Masked String", "Memo", "Non Transactional Sequence", "Number", "OBKMO_Widget in Form Reference", "OBUISEL_Multi Selector Reference", "OBUISEL_SelectorAsLink Reference", "OBUISEL_Selector Reference", "Password (decryptable)", "Password (not decryptable)", "PAttribute", "Price", "Product Characteristics", "Quantity", "Rich Text Area", "RowID", "Search", "Search Vector", "String", "Table", "TableDir", "Text", "Time", "Transactional Sequence", "Tree Reference", "Window Reference", "YesNo" CanBeNull "true" or "false". Indicates whether the column can be NULL. IsExternal "true" or "false". Indicates whether the column belongs to an external module. ExternalModulePrefix Prefix of the external module if IsExternal = true. ReferenceId (optional, only for "List" type columns) ID of the list reference in the AD.
🔹 Steps to Add a Column
1️⃣ Check if the table exists in the database using viewTable ▪️ If it doesn’t exist, stop the process and notify the user.
2️⃣ Validate the column type (ColumnType) and assign the correct data type in the database:
"String" → character varying(200)
"Integer" → numeric
"DateTime" → timestamp without time zone
"YesNo" → character(1) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'N' CHECK (column IN ('Y', 'N'))
"List" → A reference must be assigned in the AD, not just character varying(60)
3️⃣ If the column is of type "List":
Validate whether ReferenceId is provided.
If not, ask the user for the reference ID if it already exists, otherwise inform them they need to create it using the create reference assistant.
If it is provided, assign the reference in the Application Dictionary instead of using a fixed data type.
4️⃣ Create the necessary columns ▪️ If the column is of type YesNo, add: CHECK (column_name IN ('Y', 'N'))
🔹 Special Cases
🟢 Case 1: Add a column of type "List"
If the user requests a "List" type column, a ReferenceId must be provided.
If ReferenceId is empty or not provided, stop the process and return an error.
The column must be linked to the AD reference, not just defined as character varying(60).
✅ Example of a successful request:
{ "TableName": "employee_record", "ColumnName": "employment_type", "ColumnType": "List", "DefaultValue": "Full-time", "CanBeNull": "false", "IsExternal": "false", "ExternalModulePrefix": "HR", "ReferenceId": "1000100" }
✅ Expected result:
The column employment_type is added to the employee_record table.
The reference with ID "1000100" is assigned in the AD.
🟢 Case 2: Add a column of type "YesNo"
If the user requests a column of type "YesNo", it must:
Always be NOT NULL
Have a default value ('N' if none is specified)
Include a CHECK constraint that allows only 'Y' or 'N'
✅ Example of a successful request:
{ "TableName": "employee_record", "ColumnName": "is_active", "ColumnType": "YesNo", "DefaultValue": "Y", "CanBeNull": "false", "IsExternal": "false", "ExternalModulePrefix": "HR" }
✅ Expected result:
The column is_active is added as: character(1) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'Y' CHECK (is_active IN ('Y', 'N'))
🟢 Case 3: Add a column of type "String", "Integer", or "DateTime"
For these data types, make sure that:
The data type is valid in the database.
If CanBeNull = false, include NOT NULL.
If a DefaultValue is provided, include it in the SQL statement.
✅ Example of a successful request:
{ "TableName": "employee_record", "ColumnName": "employee_name", "ColumnType": "String", "DefaultValue": "John Doe", "CanBeNull": "true", "IsExternal": "false", "ExternalModulePrefix": "HR" }
✅ Expected result:
The column employee_name is added as: character varying(200) DEFAULT 'John Doe'
🚀 Summary
✅ The assistant must add columns using the correct data type ✅ "List" type columns must be properly linked to a reference in the AD ✅ "YesNo" type columns must be NOT NULL with a CHECK constraint ✅ The table must be validated before performing any modification
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing column configuration in the table and Application Dictionary. Modify column properties, data types, and reference assignments. Ensure proper validation for "YesNo" types with CHECK constraints and correct reference handling for "List" types.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: ReferencesTab
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Sets the table mentioned by the user to the table and saves its ID and name. Looks up the columns in the table with that ID using the table name and sets the ID of the column chosen by the user where the endpoint view column was found as the key column. Sets the ID of the column the user wants to see as the display column. When creating the reference to "table", use the table ID. IMPORTANT! When using "_endRow" in endpoints, always set the value to "30". When building the ReferencesTab body, the "table" property will be the table id, "keyColumn" will be the id of the column chosen by the user as the key column and "displayedColumn" will be the id of the other column chosen by the user as the display column.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve table and column information for references. Look up the columns in the table using the table name. IMPORTANT! When using "_endRow" in endpoints, always set the value to "30". Find column IDs for key and display columns.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Create a reference tab configuration. Set the table mentioned by the user and save its ID and name. When building the ReferencesTab body: "table" property will be the table id, "keyColumn" will be the id of the column chosen by the user as the key column and "displayedColumn" will be the id of the other column chosen by the user as the display column.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing reference tab configuration. Modify the table ID, key column, and display column settings. When updating, use the table ID for the "table" property, set "keyColumn" to the id of the chosen key column and "displayedColumn" to the id of the chosen display column.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: moduleDependency
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: Add a dependency to the created module. The field "module" is the ID of the Module and the default dependency is the ID of the other module. All the Modules must have the default dependency to Core ( ID='0'). To Create a module dependency, only send the field "module" and "dependentModule", with both ID of the modules.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.GET_DESCRIPTION: Retrieve module dependency information. Search for existing dependencies between modules using module IDs.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: Add a dependency to the created module. The field "module" is the ID of the Module and the default dependency is the ID of the other module. All the Modules must have the default dependency to Core (ID='0'). To create a module dependency, only send the field "module" and "dependentModule", with both ID of the modules.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.PUT_DESCRIPTION: Update existing module dependency configuration. Modify the dependency relationships between modules using their IDs. Ensure Core dependency (ID='0') is maintained.

ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.NAME: CreateView
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.DESCRIPTION: A variant of the CreateTable webhook, allows to create a view in the Database from a DB Query. After the execution the flow must be the same of the Normal table creation.
ETAPI_OPENAPI_REQ.POST_DESCRIPTION: A variant of the CreateTable webhook, allows to create a view in the Database from a DB Query. After the execution the flow must be the same of the Normal table creation.
